intro: Tirucalia karrooensis, commonly known as the Karroo tickbush, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its dense, thorny growth habit. The plant produces small, white or pinkish flowers that bloom in spring, followed by small, round berries. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky or sandy soils. The species is also valued for its use in traditional medicine and as a source of livestock forage.
